items.title: Head of Engineering
items.about:
Ahmad is the Head of Engineering at Mashape, a Technology Entrepreneur, Dog Lover and an advocate of all things open-source.

When not busy building API tools, Ahmad blogs about Technology & Leadership, and fills his time maintaining & contributing to many open source projects, he also organizes Workshops & Hackathons in Toronto, Montreal & San Francisco.

items.title: Security Lead
items.about: John Downey is the Security Lead at Braintree. Braintree helps businesses accept credit card payments online with great development tools and first class support. There he has worked on their highly available infrastructure and integrations into the banking system. In his free time he contributes to open source projects and mentors high school students in the FIRST Robotics Competition.

items.title: Program Coordinator
items.about:
Andrew is a dad, educator and UX designer with a focus on Mobile Design. He is also a coffee aficionado, avid cyclist, all-round pirate and HTML5 Evangelist.

Andrew’s work ranges from prototyping communications systems for public transit to information visualization and knowledge building. Past client work includes AT&T, Bell Canada, Bell Mobility, Alliance-Atlantic, Molson Canadian and the Royal Bank of Canada.

Andrew coordinates a postgraduate program in Interactive Multimedia at Sheridan College, and writes about how kids adapt and use technology on his blog.

items.title: Creative Director
items.about:
Tin Kadoic is a designer living in New York.

He has designed digital products for more than 12 years and in the last few years he has founded a digital agency, taught UX design at uni, organized meetups on two continents and moved to NYC. Working as a Creative director @fivenyc, a design driven app development company he leads a team of designers building mobile products. He’s a core team member on @IxDAEurope, organizes #designfirst meetups and shares his ideas on @medium. His wish is to further the meaning and reach of experience and interaction design.

items.title: Development Manager
items.about: With a degree from the Université Laval in computational astrophysics; Joel has been a key member of Macadamian Technologies’ healthcare software development team for the past 2 years. During his time off, Joel can usually be found programming node bots.

items.title: Senior Software Innovator
items.about:
Marconi has been writing software for fun and profit since last century, when the Internet was still black & white and silent. He loves computers, Internet, curly braces, angle brackets, and working with great people.

Marconi is Senior Software Innovator at Originate in Toronto and a speaker at multiple conferences, including Scala Days San Francisco, Scala Days Amsterdam, NE Scala, Lambda Conf, Scala by the Bay, and PNW Scala. He spends most of his free time trying to get his little daughter out of trouble.

From HTML to LEDs, Android to Arduino — Pearl Chen takes on a cross-disciplinary approach to her work. With over 10 years of professional experience in building interactive experiences, Pearl currently works independently as both a developer and educator. 

Pearl's goal is to raise the bar for technology education by creating engaging and eﬀective educational user experiences. Pearl has worked with Intel, Google, TELUS, Ladies Learning Code, Samsung, and the CFC Media Lab. Pearl also runs electronics and web development workshops under the umbrella of her own company, Karma Laboratory.

items.title: Developer Advocate
items.about: Kendrick is a reformed sysadmin turned coder and awaits for an idea to spawn to tackle it with Ruby or Javascript. In his daily role as a Developer Advocate for EMC {code}, he works with a team to focus and publish all things open source.

items.title: VP of Engineering
items.about: When not collecting Hello Kitty accessories, Oren likes to create things and break them apart. He hacks on Node.js and Docker at Sanguine and eats Javascript for breakfast.

Gunnar Wagenknecht is Director of Engineering at Tasktop where he is responsible for Engineering Services, Operations and Engineering Effectiveness. Before Tasktop he was CTO at AGETO and lead the development and operation of a multi-tenant, worldwide e-commerce platform serving millions of transactions each day. He also is a prolific contributor with many years of experience in the Eclipse Open Source Community where he has recently been awarded with the Lifetime Contribution Award. Apart from software and computers he loves chatting about fishing, diving and other things that matters over a good beer or a glass of wine.

Lionel is a developer at Braintree and a graduate student at the University of Chicago. He works mostly on backend systems at Braintree, and is interested in programming languages, compilers, and distributed systems.

items.title: Director of Engineering
items.about: David Copeland is a programmer and author. He wrote "The Senior Software Engineer" and "Build Awesome Command-Line Applications in Ruby", and has over 18 years of professional development experience. He's managed high-performance, high-traffic systems at LivingSocial, helped build the engineering team at Opower, and worked consulting gigs both large and small. Currently, he's Director of Engineering at fashion start-up Stitch Fix, building a platform that will change the retail shopping experience.

items.title: Señor Software Developurr
items.about:
Chris is a software developer at Shopify where he's helped develop numerous APIs, tools and integrations. His big focus has been on making tools to make it easier to interact with Shopify. One of those tools is Theme Kit which comes from 2+ years of various projects and hack days to make a theme tool that is easy to use and support.

Other areas that Chris is passionate about are apprenticeship, education and positive work environments. Chris spends much of his spare time brewing his own beer, playing boardgames and petting cats.

items.title: Senior Software Engineer
items.about:
Ben is an experienced engineer with a background in full-stack web applications. More recently, he has focused on backend development, particularly hypermedia APIs and high-availability distributed systems.

He currently works at Comcast where he develops systems that drive the X1 experience across all platforms for millions of customers. He resides in Philadelphia with his wife and too many cats.

Former nuclear engineer now blurring the lines between work and play as a front end web developer, mentor and entrepreneur. Over the past few years she has snowboarded some of the world’s most majestic mountains, travelled to over 23 countries, cultivated movements and mentored students. Her tools of choice are HTML5, CSS3, Sass, responsive design, and JavaScript. She lives by challenging assumptions, improving process, and never settles. Now you can now find her working at Normative, Toronto based design firm that specializes in designing for the networked world.

items.title: Software Engineer
items.about: Ben Vinegar is a software engineer at Sentry, the co-author of Third-party JavaScript (Manning), and a former Torontonian. He lives and works in San Francisco.

items.title: President & COO
items.about:
For the last 30 years, Dave Todaro has been involved in all aspects of software product design, software engineering, and entrepreneurship. Dave is Founder, President and COO of Ascendle, a contract software development firm in the Seacoast New Hampshire area. Ascendle specializes in building cutting-edge web and mobile apps with their hybrid on-shore/off-shore teams.

Dave started programming at age 11 and shipped his first commercial software at age 15.

Dave is the former chairman of the Software Association of New Hampshire.

items.title: Lead Instructor, Web Developer
items.about: Ryan Christiani is a HackerYou instructor and developer based in Toronto. He is passionate about pizza, his teaching, and is committed to making tech education as accessible and exciting to others as it is to him. He is a man of many talents, and even more sneakers.

items.title: Software Developer
items.about: Simon is an experienced software developer who works at Security Compass. He is originally from the United Kingdom, and has previously worked as an aerospace engineer at Airbus.

A designer with 9 years experience working in the web, Chris is a Senior UX Architect at the Guardian newspaper, building mobile apps and news products of the future, he’s also a Lead instructor on General Assembly's London UX & Design course. Before that he designed Yahoo! Answers mobile experiences. A host and speaker @leanuxlondon as well as countless other London Meetup’s, he’s constantly sharing ideas on process, online reading consumption on @Medium. His desire is to make the web simple, fun and accessible.

Panagiotis is a Software Engineer working at Microsoft for the ACOM team (azure.microsoft.com). He is a board member of various Azure UGs around the world and has been a speaker at domestic and international events such Build, TechEd, ITProDevConnections and Windows AzureConf, talking, evangelizing, delivering training and consulting on cloud computing and the Microsoft Azure Platform, having also experience on other platforms like AWS. He has a broad knowledge of different technologies starting from .NET and managed code up to Win32 ASM and virtualization, SOA patterns/practices and Agile methodologies.

Joshua Warren has been developing web applications with PHP since 1999. He is the Founder & CEO of Creatuity in Dallas, Texas, where he works on eCommerce projects with Magento and the Yii framework. He founded Creatuity in 2008 as a development firm and has grown it to a team of over 25, including 14 developers working across 2 continents. When Joshua isn't developing, he enjoys traveling to new countries to try local food and beer while meeting developers at local meetups as well as connecting with developers around the world via Twitter.

Kristina leads the custom applications team at ResIM, building web and mobile products. Before joining ResIM in 2012, Kristina completed research projects in video game development for Ubisoft Montreal and worked for a start-up developing interactive educational web applications. 

Kristina holds a Bachelor of Computer Science degree from McGill University and tweets at @kristinabalaam.

items.title: Senior Software Developer
items.about: Before leading the development of FOAM at Google, Kevin contributed to GMail and Chrome. He is passionate about design patterns, computer languages and frameworks, and was an early adopter of now well known technologies like Java, JavasScript, and the WWW. Co-authored CGI HOW-TO (1996), which was one of the first books on programming the web. Outside of programming, Kevin enjoys spending time with his family, reading and is a certified fitness instructor.

Ian is the Lead Engineer for Salesforce SOS which is an embedded mobile SDK that enables businesses to support their customers directly in their applications with audio, video and screen sharing from a mobile device.

For the last three years Ian has been focusing on trying to build incredibly productive engineering teams that continuously deliver above and beyond expectations.

An early employee of GoInstant, Ian has spoken at conferences such as NodeDay 2014 and JQueryTO on a variety of subjects.

William is a Developer Advocate on the Mobile Engineering & Developer Relations team at Couchbase. His love for coffee and code has transcended him into the world of mobile while appreciating the offline in-person experiences. 

Prior, William worked on Developer Relations team over at Twitter, BlackBerry, and Microsoft while also having been a Software Embedded GPS engineer at Research In Motion.

William graduated from McGill University in Electrical & Software Engineering. Some previous tech conferences that William has spoke at were: GDC, Droidcon NYC, Mobileweek NYC, Ultimate Developer Event, along with various tech meetups.

Rachel is a Developer at ResIM in London ON, and Professor in the School of IT at Fanshawe College. Also a graduate of Fanshawe, Rachel has worked with clients including 3M Canada, Samsonite Canada, and colleges throughout Ontario.

Mike Kivikoski is a Designer and Developer at Cantina (cantina.co), specializing in User Interfaces and User Experience. With over 10 years of professional experience, Mike crafts solutions to User and Client problems. Mike is an expert in clearly defining problems, sketching/ideation, and design-build for possible solutions.

Mike has a video series with O’Reilly books, “UI Introduction for Engineers”, and has spoken at Creative Mornings, Ignite, Refresh Boston, Harvard and Endicott College. 

Mike has taught as an Adjunct Professor at Endicott College, teaching “Introduction to Web Development”, “Advanced Web Development”, and “Introduction to Web Design”. He received his Bachelor of Fine Arts with a concentration in Visual Communication, from Endicott College. He spent 5 years running his own consultancy, working with small and large companies building a variety of products, from simple marketing sites to complex multi-device applications.

items.title: Developer
items.about: As Ionic's Developer Advocate, I help developers while they?re building their apps and also frequently speak and write about Ionic. In my spare time, I?m a hybrid app maker, occasional musician, and craft beer lover. Based in Providence, RI.

items.title: Technical Evangelist
items.about: Rami Sayar is a technologist passionate about the intersection of art, design and the web. For the past 5 years, he has been experimenting with the bleeding edge of emerging technologies, determined to find use for them in everyday life. In his current role as a Developer Evangelist for Microsoft Canada in Montreal, Rami covers technical areas such as open source technologies, open data, and cloud computing, as well as growth hacking and marketing. He is a frequent international speaker and has spoken at prestigious conferences such as FITC, ConFoo, DroidCon, CUSEC, KWS and TEDx at HEC Montreal. Rami is prevented from sleeping by his curiosity for experimentation, his insistence on shipping high quality code and helping startups survive the grind

Founder of Nimble Ape Ltd
Google Developer Expert specialising in WebRTC
Over 2 years experience professionally in WebRTC and over 6 years experience with Node.js working on APIs and microservices

items.title: Director, Digital Experience
items.about: Arushi Srivastava is the Director of Enterprise Social Practice of the Digital Experience Practice. She advises corporate leaders on architecting next generation enterprise solutions which aim at being Social by Design and result in Immersive User Experience.

Jamie Goodyear is an Apache Software Foundation Member, open source evangelist, and computer systems analyst; he has designed, critiqued, and supported architectures for large organizations worldwide.

Jamie has worked in systems administration, software quality assurance, and senior software developer roles for businesses from ranging from small start-ups to international corporations. He has attained committer status on Apache Karaf, Servicemix, and Felix, and is a Project Management Committee member on Apache Karaf. He is co-author of Instant OSGi Starter (Packt Publishing, 2013), co-author of Learning Apache Karaf (Packt Publishing, 2013), and co-author of Apache Karaf Cookbook (Packt Publishing, 2014).

Currently he divides his time between providing high-level reviews of architectures,mentoring developers and administrators with SOA and SDN deployments, and helping to grow the Apache community.

Arthur Maltson is a Software Developer who's 70% Dev and 30% Ops. He's currently practicing DevOps during the day and, as a husband and father he's also doing DadOps at night. Arthur embodies the Full Stack developer with his passion for infrastructure automation, API crafting, front end development and making work fun by introducing and/or building new tools. 

In his spare time Arthur spends far too much time trying to keep up with the latest tech. He also occasionally blogs, Tweets and commits to OSS.

items.title: Senior Software Engineer
items.about: Technical lead for the Vision web management application for converged systems. As technical lead, I am responsible for designing, development, and communication of strategies across a moderately sized web development team with an array of skillsets. I've been passionate about web development from an early age. Outside of work I enjoy tinkering with electronics including arduino and many other 'internet of things' projects.

items.title: Senior Director, Engineering
items.about:
"Scott Persinger is a Senior Director, Engineering at Heroku. He created the Heroku Connect data synchronization product at Cloudconnect.com before joining Salesforce in 2013. Scott designed Heroku's hybrid mobile app reference architecture based on Node.js and the Ionic Framework. He was formerly VP Engineering at Showyou and a Senior Architect at webMethods (now Software A.G.). Over twenty years he has built multiple products and teams for the enterprise, consumer internet and mobile application markets.
"

items.title: CTO
items.about: Yuri Takhteyev is the CTO of Rangle.io, a JavaScript consulting firm based out of Toronto, a former faculty member at the university of Toronto, and a published author whose scholarly interests focus on open source and global software culture.

items.title: Partner
items.about: Based in Indianapolis, Nathan is a software consultant and developer at Expected Behavior. He works with high-scale enterprise companies and startups to implement application monitoring on new and existing code bases. He is also a lead developer for Expected Behavior’s application monitoring tool, Instrumental.

items.title: Architect
items.about:
"Dejan is a full-stack IBM architect always on a lookout for new architectural approaches and techniques. He worked on a number of exciting projects, from Eclipse open source, to large enterprise Web applications. In his current position, Dejan is all over modern cloud architectures consisting of Node.js micro services, using React to achieve a long-standing dream of isomorphic apps that break the server-client divide.

You can follow Dejan on Twitter or by reading his blog at http://dejanglozic.com."
